# segment_command_64

```
struct segment_command_64 {
    ...

```

## [Topics](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64#topics)

### [Instance Properties](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64#1612307)

[`cmd`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525290-cmd)[`cmdsize`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525853-cmdsize)[`fileoff`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525570-fileoff)[`filesize`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525530-filesize)Indicates the number of bytes occupied by this segment on disk. For segments that require more memory at runtime than they do at build time, `vmsize` can be larger than `filesize`. For example, the `__PAGEZERO` segment generated by the linker for `MH_EXECUTABLE` files has a `vmsize` of 0x1000 but a `filesize` of 0. Because `__PAGEZERO` contains no data, there is no need for it to occupy any space until runtime. Also, the static linker often allocates uninitialized data at the end of the `__DATA` segment; in this case, the `vmsize` is larger than the `filesize`. The loader guarantees that any memory of this sort is initialized with zeros.[`flags`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525823-flags)[`initprot`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525886-initprot)[`maxprot`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525317-maxprot)[`nsects`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525358-nsects)Indicates the number of section data structures following this load command.[`segname`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525742-segname)[`vmaddr`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525897-vmaddr)[`vmsize`](/documentation/kernel/segment_command_64/1525695-vmsize)Indicates the number of bytes of virtual memory occupied by this segment. See also the description of `filesize`, below.
